conversation/user_message:
How I file tax when income extremly low Canada?  
Need help wit form and benifit?
conversation/assistant_response:
I understand you're looking for help with filing taxes in Canada when your income is extremely low.  I can't give specific tax or financial advice, as I'm just an AI. However, I can definitely point you in the right direction!

**Here's what you need to know:**

**Filing is Still Important**

Even if you have very low income, it's important to file your taxes in Canada. You might be eligible for benefits and credits that can help you, even if you don't owe any taxes.

**Key Forms and Benefits**

* **T1 General Income Tax and Benefit Return:** This is the main form you'll use to file your taxes. You can download it from the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) website: [https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency.html](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency.html)

* **Canada Child Benefit (CCB):** If you have children, this is a monthly payment to help with the cost of raising them.

* **Goods and Services Tax/Harmonized Sales Tax (GST/HST) Credit:** This is a quarterly payment to help offset the cost of GST/HST.

* **Working Income Tax Benefit (WITB):** This is a refundable tax credit for low- to moderate-income working individuals and families.

* **Canada Workers Benefit (CWB):** This is a refundable tax credit for low-income working individuals and families.

**Getting Help**

* **CRA Website:** The CRA website has a wealth of information about filing taxes and claiming benefits. 
* **CRA Taxpayer Services:** You can call the CRA at 1-800-959-8281 for assistance.
* **Community Volunteer Income Tax Program (CVITP):** This program offers free tax preparation assistance to low-income Canadians. Find a location near you: [https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/community-volunteer-income-tax-program.html](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/community-volunteer-income-tax-program.html)
* **Non-profit Organizations:** Many community organizations offer free or low-cost tax preparation services.


**Remember:**

* **Gather your documents:** You'll need your social insurance number, income slips (T4s, T4As, etc.), and any other relevant documents.
* **File on time:** The deadline to file your taxes is usually April 30th each year.
* **Keep records:** Keep copies of your tax return and all supporting documents for at least six years. 


I hope this helps! Good luck with your tax filing.
